entry.title: 3C 345 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the quasar 3C 345 has a jet (pictured) that appears to move five to fifteen times faster than the speed of light?

entry.title: Patricia Davies (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Patricia Davies and Jean Argles, two sisters who signed the Official Secrets Act as World War II codebreakers, did not find out about each other's top-secret work until the 1960s?

entry.title: Keine Kameraden (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1978, Keine Kameraden's findings – that 3.3 million Soviet prisoners of war died of ideologically motivated mistreatment – caused a sensation in Germany?

entry.title: Luisa González (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 2023 Ecuadorian presidential candidate Luisa González was pepper-sprayed by the National Police while on her way to register her candidacy?

entry.title: Preußisches Obertribunal (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that few decisions have instigated more discussion in German criminal law scholarship than an 1859 judgement of the Preußisches Obertribunal?

entry.title: A Little Sound (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that A Little Sound began uploading music to her YouTube channel when she was eleven years old?

entry.title: Noel Road (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Kenneth Halliwell murdered his lover Joe Orton with a hammer at their flat in London's Noel Road, before taking a drug overdose?

entry.title: Ben Phillips (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ben Phillips replaced his friend's hair gel with superglue, put Viagra in his sports drink, and placed him on a lake while he slept on an inflatable mattress?
